tif

Class TifParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractImageParser
      • tif.TifParser

  • public class TifParser
extends AbstractImageParser
    This program aims to read TIF image files and retrieve data structured in a series of Image File Directories (IFDs).

    TIF Data Stream

    The TIF data stream begins with an 8-byte header, which specifies the byte order (either big-endian II or little-endian MM), a fixed identifier (0x002A), and the offset to the first IFD. The file is composed of one or more IFDs, each containing a series of tags that define the image's characteristics and metadata.

    The TIFF specification is extensible, allowing for custom tags and nested sub-directories, such as the EXIF (Exchangeable Image File Format), which is a common sub-directory used in both TIFF and JPEG files.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    TIFF 6.0 Specification

    • Method Detail

      • parseTiffMetadataFromBytes

        public static TifMetadata parseTiffMetadataFromBytes(byte[] payload)
        Parses TIFF metadata from a byte array, providing information on extracted IFD directories.

        For efficiency, use this static utility method where TIFF-formatted data, such as an embedded EXIF segment, is already available in memory. It directly processes the byte array to extract and structure the metadata directories without having to read a file from disk again.

        Note: This method assumes the provided byte array is a valid TIFF or EXIF payload, including the 8-byte header length. No external validation is performed.

        Parameters:
        payload - byte array containing TIFF-formatted data
        Returns:
        parsed metadata. If parsing fails, it guarantees an empty (but non-null) TifMetadata object is returned

      • readMetadata

        public boolean readMetadata()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Orchestrates the extraction of TIFF metadata by parsing all Image File Directories (IFDs) within the file. *

        This method converts raw IFD entries into a structured TifMetadata object. Per metadata standards, if multiple XMP blocks exist, the final instance is given precedence. To implement this last-one-wins strategy efficiently, the parser searches directories in reverse order and stops at the first IFD_XML_PACKET (Tag 0x02BC) it finds.

        Specified by:
        readMetadata in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        true if at least one Image File Directory was successfully parsed and the metadata object is populated; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a low-level I/O error or data corruption is detected during random-access reading.

      • getMetadata

        public Metadata<DirectoryIFD> getMetadata()
        Retrieves the extracted metadata, or a safe fallback if unavailable.
        Specified by:
        getMetadata in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        a TifMetadata object containing the extracted IFDs, or a new empty TifMetadata object if parsing has not occurred
